error.signature: Your requirements could not be resolved to an installable set of packages. Problem 1 - Root composer.json requires package/name ^2.0 -> satisfiable by package/name[2.0.0] - package/name 2.0.0 requires other/dep ^3.0 -> found other/dep[3.0.0] but it conflicts with your root composer.json require (^2.0)
error.regex: Your requirements could not be resolved to an installable set of packages

verdict.summary: Composer dependency conflicts occur when two or more packages require incompatible versions of a shared dependency. This is especially common when upgrading major versions of frameworks or when mixing packages from different ecosystem generations.

dead_ends.why_fails: This flag only bypasses platform requirements (PHP version, extensions), not package version conflicts. Even if it did work, ignoring requirements leads to runtime errors when incompatible code is loaded together.

dead_ends.action: Manually editing composer.lock to force a version
dead_ends.why_fails: Editing composer.lock directly corrupts the dependency graph integrity. Composer will detect the hash mismatch and refuse to install, or worse, install an inconsistent set of packages that fail at runtime.

workarounds.action: Use 'composer why' and 'composer depends' to find the conflict chain, then update constraints
workarounds.how: Run 'composer why package/name' to see why each version is required. Run 'composer depends other/dep --tree' to visualize the dependency chain. Adjust version constraints in composer.json to allow compatible versions. Use 'composer update --with-dependencies' to re-resolve.

workarounds.action: Use composer's replace/provide fields or --with-all-dependencies to resolve the conflict
workarounds.how: If the conflict is between two packages that provide the same interface, add a 'replace' field in composer.json to tell Composer which package supersedes the other. If one package is a fork, use 'replace' to indicate it provides the same functionality. Use 'composer require package/name:^2.0 --with-all-dependencies' to let Composer re-resolve the full dependency tree.

leads_to.condition: when a forced resolution installs an incompatible version that is missing expected classes

preceded_by.condition: when a failed migration prompts updating the ORM package which then causes conflicts

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Dependency conflict prevents installation entirely while autoload not found means packages are installed but the autoloader cannot locate a specific class
